DOC.detailed_description: The Vet-COACH study peer health coaching program help reduce Cardiovascular disease ( CVD ) risk among Veterans . The goal study test effectiveness home-visit peer health coach intervention promote health outcome behavior change among Veterans multiple CVD risk factor hybrid type 1 implementation study . The study focus Veterans poorly control hypertension least one CVD risk factor target high risk population . The study conduct randomize control trial enroll n=590 Veterans compare peer health coach intervention consist home visit , telephone support , linkages appropriate community-based clinic resource compare usual VHA primary care . The primary outcome reduction systolic blood pressure baseline follow-up 1-year . Secondary outcome include reduction Framingham Cardiovascular risk score , individual cardiovascular risk ( tobacco use , lipid ) , health relate quality life , health care use . The investigator also assess effect peer health coach intervention intermediate outcome include social support , patient activation , patient/provider communication health behavior ( e.g . medication adherence , physical activity , nutrition , alcohol use , stress management ) .
